question:
With reference to the coexistence of undernourishment and obesity found by the Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey, consider the following statements:
  1. Uttar Pradesh has the highest number of obese adolescents.
  2. The WHO was involved in this survey.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The highest number of obese adolescents were reported in Goa. This is in the age group of 10 to 19 year olds. Tamil Nadu had the largest number of either obese or overweight adolescents according to the study. 5% of adolescents had high blood pressure and 4% had high cholesterol levels. Statement 2 is incorrect: The survey did not involve the WHO. It is a joint effort between UNICEF and the ministry of health and family welfare of the Indian government. This is the first ever study in India to measure malnutrition, micronutrients deficiency, etc. through biochemical measurements and through use of anthropometric data.
